title: [K-12] School Library Service Design for Dyslexic Students in the Digital Age

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of dyslexia, foundational experience in using school libraries, and basic digital device operation skills
context.additional_context: Project-based learning environment combining digital technology and library services to improve accessibility for dyslexic students

learning_goals: Learners can design and propose three or more digital library services to reduce information access barriers for students with dyslexia.
Learners can develop a plan for creating dyslexia-friendly learning materials by applying the 5E instructional model (Engage, Explore, Explain, Elaborate, Evaluate).
Learners can write a report analyzing the impact of improved library services on enhancing information literacy for students with dyslexia.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
